intro: Piriqueta pampeana, commonly known as the Pampas piriqueta, is a flowering plant native to the Pampas region of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and has hairy, narrow leaves that help reduce water loss. Its yellow flowers bloom in the spring and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Piriqueta pampeana is an important component of the local flora, contributing to the ecological balance of its habitat.
